## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
# 1) Make sure TinyTeX/TeX Live is up to date
tinytex::tlmgr_update("--self")
tinytex::tlmgr_update()

# 2) Pre-install core LaTeX bundles you’re likely missing
pkgs <- c(
  # KOMA + LaTeX3
  "koma-script", "l3kernel", "l3packages",
  # Engines/fonts for xelatex
  "fontspec", "unicode-math", "xltxtra", "xunicode",
  # Common essentials
  "latex-bin", "etoolbox", "graphics", "xcolor", "tools",
  "hyperref", "geometry", "caption", "booktabs", "multirow",
  "threeparttable", "float", "amsmath", "amsfonts", "amssymb",
  # Pandoc templates often use these
  "ulem", "setspace", "titlesec", "fancyhdr", "csquotes"
)
tinytex::tlmgr_install(pkgs)

# (Optional) If you want a broader “just work” set:
# tinytex::tlmgr_install(c("collection-latex", "collection-latexrecommended", "collection-fontsrecommended"))

# 3) Sanity check: can

```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
